title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Wednesday 23 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: convict who 'thought about killing everyday ' made knife in prison .
'record rise ' in reports of child neglect in the south west , says nspcc .
pedestrian injured in st ives crash .
claims trees 'killed off on purpose ' at planned holiday village .
surfers help track changes in sea temperature .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from the cornwall and devon bbc local live team for today .
we 're back from 08:00 tomorrow with more news , travel , sport and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: cat rescued after trapped behind staircase for five days
text: a 12-year-old cat has been rescued after being trapped behind a staircase for five days .
hattie 's worried owners contacted the rspca after unsuccessfully trying to encourage the her from a gap under the stairs outside their truro home .

rspca inspector jonathan phipps said : we eventually managed to pull her through a hole we 'd made under the steps and coaxed her to come towards us with a can of tuna but it was certainly a struggle getting her out .
`` we 'd first visited on saturday and tried to encourage her to climb a towel to free herself from the steep drop and she 'd gamely tried to struggle her way up but just kept dropping back down .

`` her owners had spent sunday trying to get her to come out with no success and when i arrived on monday it became clear she 'd be unable to get out so i called cornwall fire and rescue service to help , and they were absolutely amazing . ''
hattie 's owner heather mcpherson thanked the rescuers and said : `` we 'd only just moved into the house and she managed to get through a stupid pipe and fell down into the space .
`` we could hear her crying but could n't get her out .
the team from the rspca and the retained firefighters were absolutely superb . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather : fine day with spells of sunshine
text: thursday will be a fine day with spells of sunshine .
any showers will be very isolated and most places will stay dry .
temperatures will reach the low 20s with light winds .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: tea for tou-cans
text: two rare toucan chicks which hatched at paignton zoo environmental park in devon are being hand-reared by their keepers .
the zoo is the only collection in the uk to have hatched the toco toucan species this year .
the baby birds are being looked after by keepers because their parents have failed to rear previous chicks .
they tuck into baby bird formula and fruit every two hours from 07.00 until 22.00 .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: night ramble in devon
text: you can take a walk on the wildside in east devon with a night-time ramble through cranbrook tonight .
the park ranger will help you explore - there 'll be stargazing and campfire snacks .
there 's also a bat walk at seaton wetlands tomorrow night and you can spend twilight with the devon bat project looking for the flying , furry critters .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: ten people stranded on a beach rescued by plymouth lifeboat crew
text: plymouth lifeboats rescued stranded people in two separate incidents on tuesday evening .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: people urged to speak up if they suspect child is being neglected
text: people in cornwall are being urged to speak up if they suspect a child they know is being neglected .
it follows a report from the nspcc that says reports of suspected child neglect in the county have risen by nearly 30 % in the past year .
the concerns included young children being left alone and allegations of alcohol and drug abuse with youngsters in the house .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: car stuck on grass bank after crash
text: a car got stuck on a grass bank after a crash in devon .
firefighters were called to home park , in ashburton at 11:04 this morning after reports of a collision .
they discovered a car had left the road .
crews used a winch and small tools to release the car and make it safe .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter husky returns after owner told he was killed by train
text: a dog from exeter believed killed by a train after going missing has been reunited with his relieved owner .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: man suffers facial injuries after being assaulted by large group of men
text: a man was assaulted and had his £ 1,000 necklace stolen , police have said .
detectives from camborne are appealing for information about the assault and robbery which happened in between 03:00 and 03:30 on saturday 12 august in redruth .
a 21-year-old man was assaulted in the lane leading to the zone nightclub and had his gold necklace stolen during the assault .
the victim had a bottle thrown at his car and was then assaulted when he got out of his vehicle .
he suffered bruising and swelling to his face and his car was damaged .
the main suspect is described as a white man , in his mid-20s , bald or shaven head , slim build , between 5ft 10in to 6ft tall .
he was wearing a white jacket with an adidas logo on the front .
one of the men in the group was wearing a brown jacket and the other was large build with a beard .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: treasure hunting pair unearthed nearly 2000 roman coins in a field in cornwall
text: a pair of metal detecting enthusiasts have spoken of their disbelief and joy after they unearthed nearly 2,000 roman coins in a farmer 's field in cornwall .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: looe rnli have four shouts in five hours
text: volunteer crews with looe rnli were kept busy yesterday afternoon , launching to four service calls within five hours .
the calls included two children who had got into difficulty while swimming , three people cut off by the tide and an exhausted swimmer who was at risk of hypothermia .
all the incidents ended well and there were no injuries .

dave haines , lifeboat operations manager with looe rnli said : what started off with two routine service calls quickly changed with two more serious incidents as the wind increased and the sea state became rough .
`` as sea conditions worsen you can become exhausted very quickly if out swimming or rowing .
staying parallel to the shore line makes it easier to get ashore if conditions change . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel latest : fallen tree blocks road
text: travel latest : fallen tree blocks road
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: electrical pole fire tackled
text: firefighters were called to an electrical pole fire in north devon earlier today .
fire crews were called to a field close to the a39 near clovelly just before 10:00 .
western power distribution was called and police shut the road for a short time .
the firm isolated the pole and crews used one hose reel jet and foam to extinguish the fire and make the area safe .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: male biker in his 20s dies after crash
text: a motorcyclist has died following a crash in bishopsteignton , devon .
police and paramedics were called to the a381 newton road at 09.30 following the collision between the motorcycle and a vauxhall astra car-derived van .
the male motorcyclist , who was in his 20s and from teignmouth , had serious injuries and was airlifted to derriford hospital where he later died .
his family has been told .
the road remains closed while specialist officers carry out an investigation work .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: breakingmotorcyclist dies after road crash
text: a motorcyclist has died following a serious road crash in bishopsteignton this morning , police have said .
more to follow .

documents.title: ikea exeter unboxed
text: one of the biggest developments in exeter for years is taking shape , with ikea 's easily recognisable blue structure now in place off the a379 .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: breakingconvict who 'thought about killing everyday ' made knife in prison
text: a man jailed for life for murdering a builder in plymouth told a prison officer he `` thought about killing everyday '' , leeds crown court has heard .
donald pemberton ( below ) was convicted alongside ryan williams of murdering tanis bhandari ( above ) near the kings arms pub in tamerton foliot in 2015 .
the 22-year-old , who was jailed for life with a minimum term of 23 years , was found covered in blood and possessing a makeshift knife by a prison officer at hmp wakefield in april .
he had removed the blade from his razor to make an eight-inch weapon and told the officer he `` could not stop thinking about killing '' .
pemberton , who pleaded guilty to possession of a knife , was jailed for two years concurrent to his original sentence .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: travel latest : st ives road blocked
text: cornwall
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel latest : road closed for accident investigation work
text: devon
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: stranded sunfish rescued from cornish beach
text: one of the world 's heaviest fish was rescued after becoming stranded on a cornish beach .
experts say it was the only live stranding of a sunfish on a cornish beach for at least 10 years .
lifeguards at mawgan porth called newquay 's blue reef aquarium to help rescue the fish on saturday .
with the help of british divers marine life rescue , the fish was transferred to newquay harbour where it was re-released back into the ocean .
ed wainwright , from the aquarium , said : it was amazing to see such a fantastic creature up close .
`` it 's not everyday you get to see a fish like that .
it was a great result for the stranded sunfish , especially as they are now a vulnerable species .
it was a united effort by everyone involved . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: brighter and fresher than yesterday
text: the rest of the day will be brighter and fresher than yesterday .
a few showers may pop up this afternoon .
maximum temperature 20c ( 68f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: pedestrian has 'serious head injuries '
text: a female pedestrian has suffered serious head injuries after being involved in a collision with a car .
the woman , who 's in her 80s was injured in st ives just before 11:00 .
she has been taken to hospital .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police 'well aware ' of drug issues in torquay
text: police say they are `` well aware '' of issues in certain parts of torquay involving psychoactive substances .
a police spokesman said : `` we have received reports of people clearly under the influence of drugs [ in castle circus ] , sometimes collapsing on the pavement , needing medical attention .
`` this appears mostly due to drug users taking what was a 'legal high ' referred to as s k2 , black mamba and so on .

`` amendments to the misuse of drugs act 1971 and the introduction of the psychoactive substances act 2016 mean that these drugs are now illegal to manufacture , supply and possess which gives us certain powers to search , seize and arrest where the grounds exist . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'twenty-nine people injured or killed on a38 in past five years '
text: a total of 29 people have been injured or killed in crashes on a notorious stretch of road in south-east cornwall over the past five years .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: devon story among most popular twitter hashtags
text: before twitter came along , no-one really knew what the point of the hash key was on the keyboard .
the social media network transformed its use , making it a way to tag tweets and the hashtag became a thing .
ten years on , the # symbol is used 125 million times on the platform every day around the world .
here are some of the biggest hashtags ever , mentioning big events , controversies and creating twitter moments in the process .
one from devon is also on the list
last year , a dad from the county made an urgent plea on twitter to find a replacement sippy cup for his autistic son ben .
the tweet - with the hashtag # cupforben - was retweeted more than 12,000 times .
the 14-year-old had only drunk from the double-handled cups , which are no longer produced , since the age of two .
it all ended in success when northamptonshire-based tommee tippee said it would produce 500 new cups after it searched factories worldwide and found the original mould .
author: BBC Newsbeat

documents.title: 'ten work vans a week are being robbed in plymouth '
text: ten work vans a week are being raided in plymouth by crooks robbing tradesmen of their tools , figures show .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: biker seriously injured in crash with car
text: a biker has been seriously injured in a crash in devon this morning .
police and paramedics were called to newton road , bishopsteignton , at 09:30 after the crash between a motorcycle and a vauxhall van .
the male motorcyclist was treated at the scene by paramedics before being airlifted to derriford hospital .
the road is closed in both directions .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: rare toucans hatch in devon
text: two toucan chicks have hatched at paignton zoo environmental park in devon .
the charity zoo is the only collection in the uk to have hatched this species this year , and one of only three in europe to have bred this bird in 2017 .
the toco is the largest and probably the best-known member of the toucan family .
the chicks are demanding - they are fed first is at 07.00 , then every two hours or so until 10.00 - with meals of baby bird formula and fruit , which has to be prepared and delivered by hand .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: labour mp says 'merit ' in women-only train carriages
text: women-only train carriages should be considered to combat increasing reports of sexual violence on public transport , a labour frontbencher has said .
shadow fire minister chris williamson said it would be `` worth consulting '' on the policy after such crimes doubled in the past five years .

it follows a 17-year-old girl being sexually assaulted twice , by two different men on a train journey between newquay and plymouth as she made her way home from the boardmasters festival on august 12 .
some 1,448 offences were reported in 2016/17 , compared with 650 incidents in 2012/2013 , british transport police figures show .
however , labour colleagues have criticised the move as `` normalising attacks '' .
labour 's chris williamson ( @ derbychrisw ) says it 's `` worth consulting '' on women-only trains , but more importantly `` we need more guards ''
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: camborne police sergeant scoops award
text: a police sergeant from camborne is to be honoured in recognition of being absolutely outstanding in his role '' .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: water plume 'caused by contractors damaging pipes '
text: a huge plume of water was caused by damage to water pipes by contractors , south west water has said .
the company said in a statement : `` while working to connect two existing raw water mains , contractors working on behalf of south west water inadvertently damaged one of the 1m pipes .
`` both pipes carry untreated water , so customers ' drinking water supplies are not affected .
`` we are currently isolating the damage and will repair the pipe as soon as possible .
`` the raw water mains supply crownhill water treatment works , but the works can be supplied by other sources during the repair . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: elderly man injured in st ives
text: elderly pedestrian seriously injured following collision on the stennack , st ives .
localised closures in place , emergency services at scene
author: Twitter

documents.title: 'reports of child neglect up 30 % ' in cornwall
text: the nspcc says cases of suspected child neglect flagged to authorities in cornwall have increased by nearly 30 % in the last year .
reports made to the charity 's helpline ranged from concerns about children being left home alone to allegations of alcohol and drug abuse with youngsters in the house .
the charity said it had to raise 173 official reports of concern with the authorities .
police have told the bbc , the rise in reports is actually a good thing because people have the confidence to come forward .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: homeless people speak out
text: from being spat on to sleeping rough on the hoe , four homeless people have told the herald their personal stories .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: travel news : air ambulance attends accident in great torrington
text: travel news : air ambulance attends accident in great torrington

documents.title: south west water investigating plume of water
text: reports of a burst water main causing a plume of water in plymouth is being investigated by south west water .
residents have said the water main is on coombe lane , tamerton foliot .
the firm said `` a technician is en route to investigate '' and it had `` received several reports '' .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: popular pcso to leave devon and cornwall police
text: a tweeting pcso with almost 14,000 followers has announced she is to leave the police .
pcso kirsty down is to leave the force in september
a message from me , with a heavy heart .
thank you for everything , it 's been a pleasure .
# police
kirsty we have never met but i really admire your candour , honesty and integrity .
best wishes for the future .
glaa is hiring !
check us out !
bless you paul thanks very much !
ooh i may well do thank you # police
sounds like it could be right up your street kirsty !
who knows lovely ! !
# police
what are you moving on to ?
i 've no idea : o eeek !
# police
well good luck
thanks # staysafe out there ; ) # police
oh no !
you 're a legend kirsty !
i know you 'll be missed in your role .
good luck with whatever your next chapter brings .
thanks gordon , for all your support over the years , catch you at a game sometime ; ) # police : )
many people say positive things about how you communicate # police matters & i promised you an on-duty coffee as a poke in the eye to the sun
holding you to that ; ) # police
kirsty , always remember , there 's at least one ole army veteran that is a big fan of yours .
im missing you already .
# legend
thank you lovely , i 'll still be around on here somewhere # police
you bloody better be young lady .
lol .
my t/l is n't the same without you in it .
ca n't get rid of me that easily # police
we would n't dream of getting rid of you
it is n't gon na happpen .
kirsty is here to stay .
job done i 'd say .
ca n't believe my daily dose of saltash is no more.thanks for the entertaining texts.be safe whatever you do and keep lighting up the world .
thanks for following sir , hope to see you on my new page when opened .
take care # police
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: two charged over intent to supply ex 'legal high '
text: two people have been charged after police seized a quantity of the psychoactive substance s
a 29-year-old man and a 25-year-old woman have been charged with possession with intent to supply the former 'legal high ' .
both are appearing at south devon magistrates court today .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: breakingreports of burst water main in plymouth
text: reports of a plume of water in plymouth due to a burst water main are being investigated
residents have reported the water in tamerton foliot .
a statement from south west water said : `` we 've received several reports of a burst main in the vicinity of moses close , plymouth , and a technician is en route to investigate . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: students turn degree project into award-winning business
text: students from the university of exeter have turned a degree project on how to charge up mobile phones into an award-winning business .
the students on the renewable energy degree course plan to set up a network of dispensers around the country .
they 'll give out battery packs powered by renewable electricity under the banner chargedup .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: '60 % increase in reports of child neglect ' in devon
text: the nspcc says there 's been a record rise in reports of child neglect to its helpline in devon and cornwall .
this year in devon it has referred 360 cases to the police and social services - an increase of 60 % compared to 2016 .
across both counties , it has referred 533 cases .
det supt steve parker , the head of protection for devon and cornwall police , said the rise is actually a good thing as more people are willing to come forward to the authorities .
the nspcc also believes more people are willing to speak up when they have concerns .
it 's calling on the government to carry out a nationwide study to establish the full scale of the problem .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: travel latest : accident on a386
text: travel latest : accident on a386

documents.title: surfers help track changes in sea temperature
text: if you 've been taking to the water around devon and cornwall this summer , you may have been in the company of some serious scientists - without knowing it .
surf scientists at plymouth marine laboratory have enlisted a group of surfers to help accurately track minute changes in sea temperature .
using boards kitted out with tiny sensors they 've collected hundreds of readings .
author: BBC Spotlight

text: early low cloud will soon clear .
the rest of the day will be brighter and fresher than yesterday .
a few showers may pop up during the afternoon near the north coast .
maximum temperature : 20c ( 68f )
author: Holly Green
BBC Weather

documents.title: trees 'killed off on purpose ' , locals claim
text: it 's being claimed that trees - on the site of a proposed holiday village in north devon - are being killed off on purpose .
dozens of trunks have been ring-barked in a hedgerow that runs alongside the planned woodland holiday park near northam .
ring barking can slowly kill a tree .
the owner says no rules have been broken as the trees are not protected and insists what 's happened is part of a tree management plan .
but , some locals disagree .
author: BBC Spotlight

text: the nspcc says there 's been a record rise in reports of child neglect to its helpline in devon and cornwall .
this year it 's referred 533 cases to the police and social services - an increase of 50 % compared to 2016 .
the charity believes more people are willing to speak up when they have concerns .
it 's calling on the government to carry out a nationwide study to establish the full scale of the problem .
